title: Calories in 8 Ounces of Salmon
meta_description: Discover calories in 8 ounces of salmon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Farmed Atlantic salmon, cooked (baked or grilled), skinless, no added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by salmon type (wild vs. farmed), cooking method, portion size, and added ingredients. Check labels or sources for precision.

quick_answer.text: 8 ounces of cooked salmon offers ~467 kcal and ~50 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in 8 ounces of cooked salmon?
faqs.a: Approximately 467 kcal for farmed Atlantic salmon, cooked without added fat.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 8 ounces of salmon?
faqs.a: About 50 g of high-quality protein, supporting muscle health.

faqs.q: Does wild salmon have fewer calories than farmed?
faqs.a: Yes, wild salmon typically has ~150-180 kcal per 100 g due to lower fat.
No significant carbsâ€”0 g per serving, making it keto-friendly.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect salmon calories?
faqs.a: Baking or grilling keeps calories lower; frying with oil can add 50+ kcal per serving.
